PART 1: INTRODUCTION

In the first part of our course we will learn how to introduce ourselves then determine how we can develop our communication skills and get them certified by Cambridge University.

The certification this course will prepare you for is called the Cambridge Preliminary Exam Test, or PET. This certification is so popular that it has its own page. Click here to learn more about PET. Many of the practice exercises for the PET exam will be available on Moodle.

Although earning a PET certification is the final objective of this course, I believe it is best to develop your communication skills in general, not just for an exam.

We will work on four skills of communication in this course:

READING WRITING LISTENING and SPEAKING
(click on any one of these to find more information on how to improve these skills)

All four of these are tested on the PET exam, however my goal is for you to develop a 5th and equally important skill: to think in English.

We will also need to expand our VOCABULARY and at times correct our GRAMMAR.

To begin working on this, I have already designed four assignments for you. Click on the assignment title for more information.
